items: Start by lying flat on a bench with your feet firmly planted on the ground and your head at the end of the bench.
Grasp the EZ barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands shoulder-width apart.
Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling, holding the barbell directly above your chest.
Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows stationary and close to your head.
Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your forehead, then slowly raise it back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Targets the triceps, chest, and shoulders
Improves upper body strength and power
Can help improve bench press performance
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional bench press
Can be modified for different fitness levels and goals
Helps to improve overall muscle definition and tone in the upper body
